alert.note: Alert for Tavaputs Plateau (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 18 at 3:05PM MDT until March 23 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON MONDAY TO NOON MDT TUESDAY ABOVE 8000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory above 8000 feet, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 15 inches with locally higher amounts up to 2 feet possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...In Colorado, Grand and Battlement Mesas. In Utah, Tavaputs Plateau. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from noon Monday to noon MDT Tuesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Tuesday afternoon through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility, especially on ridge tops. A detailed map of the snowfall can be found at: www.weather.gov/gjt/winter.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
